job_title: Clinician in Jefferson, CO
pros: I have been with JCMH for 17 years, and have no intention of leaving. During this time I had several supervisors, and many team members coming and going, but I have always felt supported and accepted. During my time with the agency I went trough Master level internship and was able to start and graduate from doctoral program working full time. Apparently it would not be possible without full support and accommodation of the workplace. I very much appreciate the benefits, especially paid annual leave time, which gives me opportunity to travel around the world, which is my favorite hobby. And of course, there is no shortage of interesting and challenging clients which makes me constantly work on my skills and knowledge as therapist.
cons: Electronic records system seems to be in constant change and presents challenges.

review_title: A community mental health employer that cares about clients AND employees
job_title: Healthcare Coordinator in Lakewood, CO
pros: 1) solid PTO policy 2) very understanding if you need to leave to take care of sick kids. Family friendly. Flexible hours. 3) 401k contribution 4) administration positions pay pretty well especially if you have a masters degree 5) pretty much everyone working here is on the same page about providing the best service possible to clients. 6) decent health insurance policies
cons: 1) if you aren't an admin even with a masters degree pay is pretty low. Like $20/ hour. If you have a bachelor's degree only expect no more than $18/ hour. 2) different managers have different management styles and often work against each other to the detriment of everyone else on the team 3) meetings about meetings....think "this could have been an email y'all" 4) very little room for career growth

review_title: 3.5 / 5 - Good job but pay could be way better.
job_title: Case Manager in Lakewood, CO
pros: -Nice PTO package -Really try to prevent burnout
cons: -Very little options for a raise and being here long-term

job_title: Therapist in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Nice team and wellness hours
cons: Could be better pay for the work

review_title: Bureaucracy, exec staff did not really listen to those providing direct client care
job_title: Clinician in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Wellness hour, caring clinical staff.
cons: Low pay, case loads too high, poor communication/understanding from executive staff

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Lakewood, CO
pros: Collaborative environment Supportive management Room for growth
cons: Compensation was not comprable to assigned caseload

job_title: Peer Specialist in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Great first mental health job
cons: Low pay and poor leadership

job_title: Health Home Care Coordinator in Lakewood, CO
pros:
I'd still be working here if my grant funded position handed ended. Alas it was time to go. 
I loved working with a team of people who were as passionate about providing quality mental health services as I was. I also loved how family friendly JCMH is. With a few exceptions it was easy to take off work when my kids got sick. The instituted a better maternity leave policy when I was still there but unfortunately I didn't get to take advantage of it.
cons: Their partnership with MCPN/STRIDE CHC for medical care is tenuous at best. STRIDE leadership feigned teamwork with JCMH for YEARS. STRIDE is always looking out for...STRIDE. JCMH never seemed to grasp that STRIDE was always going to take more, and give less, in the health home partnership. The providers at STRIDE were all wonderful for the most part and I would work with them again in a heartbeat. Also It's really hard to move up here if you don't have a master's degree. Even if you do have an MA pay is really low. Like $20/ hour low. JCMH could really use a lesson in how to capitalize on newer opportunities- telehealth for example- so they can bill more services and pay their employees better .

review_title: This has been an amazing company to work for.
job_title: Case Manager in Lakewood, CO
pros: This company has been so amazing to work for. The atmosphere is positive, everyone is so friendly, and supervisors really do a great job at providing support on a daily basis. Jefferson Center has been a huge blessing and I am thankful for the experience.
cons: The only downside is the company is huge with a lot of different departments, it takes time to learn all of them and form connections with people outside of your department. Especially if you do not work closely with different departments.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Mission is worthwhile and there are many great people working there. White men will be extravagantly pampered.
cons: Management is considered an optional hobby one can dabble in occasionally, but is not required by any means. I haven’t had a performance review in years, and didn’t know who my manager was for most of this year. C Suite averages three years to make any important decision.

job_title: Shift Coordinator in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros:
Considers employee opinions
Concerned about self care
cons:
Expect overnight employees to know everything going on during day shift.
All team meeting are held during day shift making it inconvenient for overnight shifts.

review_title: Solid, stable job, but new clinicians may need better support.
job_title: Lead Clinician in Lakewood, CO
pros:
You can stick around for years and be just fine.
Decent salary and benefits for a non-profit, especially if you stay and allow it to grow and seek more opportunities for pay increases.
Decent culture and finally doing more to improve DEI.
Lots of committees, groups, etc. to join and ways to engage outside of just your primary role.
cons:
Lots of new execs and management and need for better training of managers across all areas of management and supervision (admin, clinical, DEI, etc.).
Lack of structured supervision.
Lack of response from management to reasonable requests from staff re: better supervision, both clinically and administratively. 
Burdensome software and health record.
Directors never seem to get to know their teams.
Outpatient caseloads have always been WAY too high. They should max out at 60, but they max out at 90-100.

review_title: Amazing atmosphere and great team mates
job_title: Information Systems Technician in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros:
Small team so you get to do a plethora of things keeping you very busy.
Great entry-level space for the industry.
Great people as clients that help others as there focus.
Everyone is so nice.
Benefits are really great.
cons:
Very busy.
As a non-profit, it doesn't match other industry baselines.

review_title: Completely team-dependent as others have said
job_title: Psychotherapist in Lakewood, CO
pros: If you’re on the right team you will probably find the overall culture warm and supportive, and if you interact with clients you will probably find that very rewarding
cons: If you’re on the wrong team, you won’t figure it out until it’s too late and there won’t be anything you can do about it but leave. You’re arbitrarily stuck with one supervisor and the executives are *completely* insulated against the concerns of staff levels beneath them.

job_title: Medical Billing Specialist in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: We have amazing leadership. we feel appreciated for the work that is being done, and they will respect you on your opinions and contributions. We are given space, material, and trust to do our work and do it well. There is no micro managing and a lot of communication within our department.
cons: we are little behind on sufficient programs to meet the needs of a billing department. billing system little outdated but that being worked on and our website needing to support our clients to understanding why they are being billed. this also in process of being worked out.

job_title: Case Manager in Denver, CO
pros: Good work environment, community, and co-workers. Good benefits (time off, mental health breaks)
cons: Low compensation and opportunity to grow if you do not meet education requirements (master’s degree or higher).

review_title: Best employer in over 15 years community mental health work
job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Well-run positive, genuine, motivated, and responsive workplace invested in the well-being of its staff.
cons: As is common in CMH, many clinicians complete their credentialing, then move on to pursue private practice.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Great leadership and a truly caring organization
cons: I don't have any cons to list

review_title: Great Company to work for during a pandemic
job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Evergreen, CO
pros: There was minimal lay offs with the 2020 pandemic and the company was very adaptive to telehealth, working remote, and creating safe working conditions for those who had to work in office
cons: Yearly bonus is not a regular or reliable thing. First pay raise is after working for the company for 5 years. Lots of shifts in technology, policy, and high turn over with staff who were feeling "burnt out".

job_title: Manager in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: none, agency is currently a very unhealthy place to work, pay and perks are higher at other agencies
cons: I worked at JCMH for over 8 years and the first 6.5 years were fine. Everything changed when new CEO and COO came on board. The CEO is inexperienced and worries more about her image than the welfare and wellbeing of the employees. The COO is an insecure bully that purposefully surrounds herself with sycophants. I witnessed the executive team refuse to listen to many viable options on how to avoid layoffs. The employees were terminated mid-month and left with only 2 weeks of health insurance during the height of the COVID pandemic. Some of the laid off positions were rehired just a few weeks later with slightly different job descriptions. The agency is not a healthy one and frontline staff are often not aware of the incompetence and dysfunction of the current executive team.

job_title: Therapist in Lakewood, CO
pros: Not that I can think of....
cons: No support. Limited communication. Horrible pay!

job_title: Medical Assistant in Denver, CO
pros: Flexible, work from home, Close to home, top 50 places to work, easy
cons: Morning shift only, no overtime, hardly any raises, poor supervision

job_title: Human Resources Director in Arvada, CO
pros: Top Workplace, women led, mission driven organization with caring culture.
cons: Non-profit so difficulty competing in the market.

job_title: Human Resources Director in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Caring culture, great benefits and opportunities for growth.
cons: Non-profit limitations on pay ranges.

review_title: good company, lots of potential for employees
job_title: Innovation Analyst in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: the organization seems to be undergoing a transformation that will allow for new ideas and perspectives
cons: typical not-for-profit/medicaid funded woes --overworked long tenured employees seem burnt out

job_title: Manager in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Exec and management ask for feedback from staff and use it to make things better. I like the transparency with leadership. I love my team, caring, supportive and invested in improving the lives of the people that we serve. I have great flexibility with my job and am able take the time I need to care for myself and my family.
cons: Remote work was fun at first, but now I miss seeing my friends. Hopeful that we will be back together soon.

job_title: Pharmacy Technician CPhT in Denver, CO
pros: Great Hours and benefits for employees
cons: No consistent shifts, each day is a different shift

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros:
Great team members
Great company that is doing great work
cons: Lower salaries due to non-profit nature of work

job_title: School Therapist in Lakewood, CO

job_title: Jefferson Center of Mental Health in Lakewood, CO
pros: Great management, pay and benefits.
cons: None, I enjoy my job.

job_title: Main Operator in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros:
Company culture that walks the walk and takes mental health seriously for clients and employees
Friendly leadership that leads by example
Dedication to the community
cons: There isn't a lot of room to grow in some areas of the company

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Lakewood, CO
pros: Great training opportunities for staff

review_title: Good experience but difficult to move up
job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Lakewood, CO
pros: Experience, training opportunities, supportive coworkers

job_title: Employment Specialist in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Supportive culture that seems to invest a lot in taking care of employees, future-focused

job_title: Secretary in Denver, CO
pros: Great to clients and family’s
cons: Not great for employees and their families

job_title: Administration in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros:
-Everyone is so friendly and helpful and great to work with. 
-Jefferson Center has so many wonderful benefits, a ton of paid time off, a comprehensive wellness program, paid-for training opportunities, tuition reimbursement, awards, and a lot more. 

-There is a great work-life balance culture, and I am never expected or asked to work late/overtime. 
-The center has a lot of progressive and inclusive policies. 
-Management shows a lot of appreciation and is always there to talk to and listen.  
-There are a lot of opportunities to be involved with and interact with other staff members. 
-It is great working for an organization that directly helps the communities that we serve, and that continues to adapt to how we can be better, and that really cares. When talking with other employees, and upper management, it is clear that everyone is really invested in our consumers welfare, as well as the welfare of our employees.
cons:
-There are not a lot of work-from-home opportunities. 
-Not super technologically advanced, but it's improving!
-Compensation is lower compared to for-profit organizations, but that is expected, and the benefits and culture definitely make up for it.

job_title: Pre-doctoral Intern in Denver, CO
pros: Supportive and positive environment to work in.  Ability for advancement and to gain knowledge from different disciplines.  Get to feel part of a team and be involved with treatment team planning.  Have access to a multitude of populations to enhance clinical skils.  Supervisors are very helpful and always make time for consultation or supervision.
cons: Very difficult population and a lot of paperwork.  Some of the clients can be very demanding and try to manipulate you into giving them what they want.  At times you feel you are spending more time completing paperwork than working with clients.  It can be very difficult to meet paperwork deadlines with high caseloads.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Lakewood, CO
pros: The other employees here are friendly, supportive, and helpful. The organization provides a lot to the community in terms of low-cost, accessible mental health services and wellness classes. The management tries to be transparent and does a good job of communicating with employees on a regular basis.
cons: In my particular position, the work can sometimes feel a bit isolating. I believe this relates specifically to the fact that my position is specialized, so there is only one person in my department with the same job title, and we work on different days.

review_title: Taking Care of New Employees during COVID-19
job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Evergreen, CO
pros: The company was amazing about on boarding me through this chaotic time. I was nervous with so many other companies issuing furloughs and lay offs that as a new hire I would be postponed in my start date. But my supervisor spoke on my behalf and helped insure that I start  at full time rate, with benefits, and training from home.
cons: Starting was chaotic as most of the work I will be doing will be in person, but I'm meeting the team through Zoom and learning the ins and outs of the company through the computer.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Good HR department, good culture, good perks and benefits, generous time off, doing something good for humanity
cons: The job I have right now is very boring. There are huge swaths of time where I don't have anything to do and I feel useless. Yes I am helping people but I don't have time to see clients because of other less enjoyable job duties

review_title: Proud to work at Jefferson Center
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Serving the community and making mental health care accessible to everyone. Lots of opportunity for training including evidenced-based treatment modalities. Helpful and reliable clinical supervision. All employees get a weekly wellness hour, generous vacation time, and comprehensive benefits.
cons: Intensity of clients is on par with community mental health - as to be expected. Salary increases would likely help decrease the turnover rate. Electronic health record is frustrating at times.

review_title: Great Culture & Outstanding Place to Work!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: It’s been a wonderful experience to work at the Center for the past 20+ years! I’ve learned and grown so much in my profession over the years. I’ve felt supported and been treated very well. Caring culture and so many amazing people. Jefferson Center is very innovative and has an incredible CEO.
cons: Nothing comes to mind as I really enjoy my work and the employees.

review_title: Lousy Ethics and Even Worse Employee Gossip Sessions
job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: You will meet some very nice people and often they are the first to be fired or laid off. The rest are very fake. They will be your buddy to your face and bad mouth you behind your back.
cons: Over paid "elite" corporate managers who do less than little actual work. Most days are filled with simply trying to perform at break neck paces just to keep your job so they can make huge profits at the expensive of quality care for clients.

review_title: Great entry level job experience working with clients in active addiction.
job_title: Addiction Technician in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: This is the place for someone’s first experience in recovery/addiction/mental health.  I learned great de-escalation skills. Amazing opportunity to serve people in addiction.   Relatively easy work (after I got computer system down).  Intakes, discharges, vitals, hospital pu/do and notes.  CAC hrs received.  Great company.
cons: Large gap from detox to treatment that many clients fall in that I personally did not like but as a detox JCMH did well.  Training could of been better.

review_title: 	Provide psychiatric nursing services to consumers. Collaborate with prescribers in all phases of medication management
job_title: Psychiatric Staff RN in Lakewood, CO
pros: Company is a non-profit and has a lot of outside resources for the consumer. They are very good to their employees and acknowledge when an employee has gone that extra mile
cons: I cannot think of any negatives with this company

review_title: Could not ask for a better community mental health agency to work for
job_title: Clincian in Lakewood, CO
pros: Robust wellness program, supervisors who actually care about wellbeing and sustainability of the role, good benefits
cons: All community mental health is challenging. I often feel productivity expectations weighing down, even as the center tries to take care of its employees. It is an ever-balancing act.

job_title: Mental Health Technician II in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Each shift worked well together and communicated well with each other.
cons: I was lied to during my interview. If you are promised clinical supervision, negotiable pay, time off when needed, tuition reimbursement, and CAC courses paid for; these are lies. I did not realize I, as well as several others, were lied to until I was in orientation.  Facts were hidden that the facility had been shot at several times and bullet casings purposely set next to the door and found in the parking lot. The higher ups did not want her staff to know that other locations had security because then staff would want security.  There were no safety protocols in place to include how to deal with lice, silver fish, and bed bugs verified on the unit, as well as water pouring out of the ceiling due to busted pipes; to just name a few instances. You cannot get tuition reimbursement until after a year of working there but you are not informed of this until after you start. There is not a clinical social worker on site to provide supervision even though you will be told in your interview that there is. You can take all the time you want off, BUT you have to find your own coverage. There is not room for advancement. A co-worker's parent passed and was approved for bereavement days by HR but he was required find his own coverage. From January until March, seven employees quit and several others including shift coordinators were looking for new jobs, SEVEN!! When asked if the higher ups would help cover shifts when people started quitting, it was stated that they had more important priorities outside of work to take care of. This is a double standard since there was no regard for any of the line staff and their priorities outside of work. I was given a few days off after having major surgery but had to find my own coverage. The pay was set in stone regardless of your degree or experience, no negotiating was available like we was informed there would be in our interview.  The line staff have been yelled at on several occasions during supervision. Food is only given out until 8 p.m., after this the patients are supposed to drink water because the unit is not a hotel as stated by the higher ups. When bed bugs were found on the unit, the shift coordinators were informed by the higher ups to not let the line staff know. We were informed anyways thank goodness, in hopes to not transfer to our homes.

review_title: Best company I ever worked for
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Excellent benefits, get a lot of time off, friendly and helpful employees.
cons: Management is out of touch

review_title: This company used to value what the staff thinks, but ever since the management changed, they don't.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Wheat Ridge, CO

cons: Very clique-ish in my office.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Wheat Ridge, CO
pros: Great company with a an incredible community focus.  Employees are very friendly and helpful.

job_title: Executive Assistant in Littleton, CO
pros: I loved working with the executive level staff. The benefits are amazing and really focus on wellness.
cons: I do not have any cons for working with JCMH.

job_title: in Naples, FL

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Lakewood, CO
